title: Cognizant to invest Rs 1,000 crore in Tamil Nadu
text: Cognizant to invest Rs 1,000 crore in Tamil Nadu IANS | Sep 10, 2015, 07.06 PM IST Cognizant vice-president Lakshmi Narayanan said the company would invest Rs 1,000 crore over five year in Chennai and Coimbatore to improve its delivery infrastructure. RELATED CHENNAI: Information technology major Cognizant on Thursday said it would expand its delivery infrastructure in Tamil Nadu, investing around Rs 1,000 crore over the next five years. In a statement, the company said the company would invest Rs 1,000 crore over the next five years on its delivery infrastructure in Chennai and Coimbatore. According to Cognizant vice-chairman Lakshmi Narayanan, the company would develop global delivery centres in these two cities and these centres, when complete, will have a capacity to accommodate around 17,000-20,000 professionals. READ ALSO: Cognizant entered a memorandum of understanding to this effect with Tamil Nadu government on Thursday. The company employs over 70,000 people across its centres in Chennai and Coimbatore. READ ALSO: Cognizant among India's top tech employers of FY15: Nasscom "We have invested over $1 billion in our operations -- in real estate and IT-related infrastructure -- in the state. Today, we operate from 16 delivery and operations centres in Chennai and Coimbatore, and continue to invest and expand our presence in the State," Narayanan said in the statement.
